analysis.summary: Niagara Falls Water Board seeks a qualified engineering consultant to perform Phase 1 sanitary sewer evaluation survey (SSES) services in specified LaSalle sewersheds, produce an engineering report and corrective action plan compliant with NYSDEC and EPG requirements, and conduct post-construction monitoring, with option pricing for Phases 2 and 3.

requirements.description: Perform Phase 1 sanitary sewer evaluation survey (SSES) work in the 91st & Luick and 81st & Frontier 1 sewersheds, including all Tasks 1–8 as defined in the RFP.

Provide option prices, schedules, and scopes to perform applicable SSES tasks for Phase 2 (81st & Frontier 2 and 80th & Lindbergh sewersheds) and Phase 3 (Mang & 88th sewershed), omitting Task 5 for Phase 2.
Identify a Project Manager as the primary contact for the project and provide project management and support throughout the engagement (Task 1).
Review existing data, records, reports, Order on Consent, and NYSDEC correspondence related to LaSalle SSO abatement and gain familiarity with the Phase 1 sewersheds and system context (Task 1b–c).

Meet with Water Board staff to discuss scope, system response, and potential locations for flow isolation and measurement; provide ongoing professional advice and participate in meetings with NFWB and NYSDEC as needed (Task 1d–e).

Provide all staff, equipment, materials, and notifications necessary to conduct smoke testing in Phase 1 sewersheds, including resident notifications, coordination with police/fire, weather-appropriate scheduling, and documentation/photography of defects (Task 2).

Conduct flow isolation and night-time weiring, including review of prior flow data, selection of adequate weir locations, provision of trained/confined-space-qualified staff and equipment (including traffic control), resident notifications, and analysis of infiltration in gpd per linear foot (Task 3).

Analyze and summarize NASSCO PACP CCTV inspection reports and manhole inspection reports provided by NFWB, determine additional data needs, coordinate with NFWB on repairs and additional CCTV, and incorporate findings (Task 4).

Perform Outfall/SSO condition assessment for the two Phase 1 outfalls (91st & Luick and 81st & Frontier 1), including review of existing info, site visits, development of an assessment work plan, execution of approved plan actions, GIS-compatible documentation, and recommendations to reduce extraneous flows (Task 5).

Conduct focused SSES (dye testing, house inspections, additional CCTV via NFWB crews) where needed to locate or confirm I&I sources, using a $10,000 contingency budget only upon NFWB approval (Task 6).

Prepare an SSES engineering report and corrective action plan for Phase 1 that identifies I&I sources, recommends cost-effective corrective actions with budgetary costs and implementation timelines, and is satisfactory to NYSDEC (Task 7).

Ensure the SSES report is prepared, stamped, and dated by a New York State licensed Professional Engineer and conforms to the Engineering Report Outline for NYS Wastewater Infrastructure Projects (October 1, 2022).
Complete the SSES report on a schedule that allows NYSDEC review early in 2023 and supports NFWB’s goal to complete construction in 2023–early 2024 and post-construction monitoring by June 2024.

Conduct post-construction monitoring in 2024 of Phase 1 improvements, including I&I assessment of pre- vs. post-construction flows and rainfall monitoring, and prepare a Post-Construction I&I Assessment and Cost Analysis Report for NYSDEC (Task 8).
Demonstrate understanding of the project situation, including LaSalle SSOs, Order on Consent, revised work schedule, sewershed ranking, and focus on I&I mitigation and sewershed-based remediation.
Demonstrate understanding of applicable regulations and standards, including NYSDEC requirements, Order on Consent, and EPG Engineering Report Outline.
Present a clear project approach, scope, and project organization tailored to the defined tasks and multi-phase program.
Demonstrate experience on similar SSES, I&I mitigation, and SSO abatement projects, including references and outcomes.
Describe experience and qualifications of any subconsultants/contractors, especially those performing more than 10% of the work, including structure, experience, and key personnel resumes.
Highlight specific experience and qualifications of key project professionals relevant to SSES, flow monitoring, I&I analysis, and NYSDEC-regulated projects.
Provide a schedule in bar chart form covering all tasks and options.
Provide an effort and budget breakdown in spreadsheet format using a task/hour estimate matrix with a not-to-exceed fee amount, including a $10,000 contingency for Task 6.
Comply with the Mandatory State Financial Assistance Terms and Conditions for Non-Construction contracts funded with NYS financial assistance, including MWBE and SDVOB requirements (Appendix F).
Meet MWBE and SDVOB participation goals: 30% combined MWBE (MBE/WBE) and 6% SDVOB, or document good-faith efforts and obtain waivers as applicable.
Submit MWBE and SDVOB utilization plans or properly completed waiver requests with the proposal, in addition to those required prior to contract execution.
Comply with monthly MWBE-SDVOB reporting requirements, including submission of Monthly MWBE-SDVOB Contractor Compliance Reports with proof of payments to subcontractors.

Submit a comprehensive statement of qualifications including business structure, licensing, years in business, similar project experience with references, key personnel, subsidiaries/parents, other business names, debarment/default history, bankruptcy, investigations, conflicts of interest, and details of subcontractors performing >10% of the work (Appendix E, Section A).
Disclose any potential conflicts of interest and plans to resolve them.

Provide required insurance coverages and certificates as specified (workers’ compensation, disability, employer’s liability, CGL, auto, umbrella, professional liability) naming NFWB, Niagara Falls Public Water Authority, and City of Niagara Falls as additional insureds, primary and non-contributory.
Agree to indemnify and hold harmless NFWB and related entities to the full extent permissible by New York law for losses arising from consultant actions/inactions (Appendix E, Section M).

Provide adequate and competent personnel with necessary licensing, education, training, and experience; ensure compliance with NFWB credentialing, security, safety, and site-specific requirements (Appendix E, Sections K, O).
Agree to operate as an independent contractor and identify proposed subcontractors in the proposal; accept NFWB right to reject subcontractors (Appendix E, Section P).
Comply with FOIL-related confidentiality marking requirements for proprietary information (Appendix E, Section R).
Maintain complete and accurate records for at least six years beyond the calendar year of creation and provide access for audit and inspection (Appendix E, Section S).
Comply with New York State breach notification and data security laws (GBL §§ 899-aa, 899-bb; State Technology Law § 208) (Appendix E, Section T).
Pay prevailing wages as required by law and submit Workforce Employment Utilization Reports as required (Appendix E, Section U).
Provide complete and accurate monthly invoices with supporting documentation; comply with MWBE/SDVOB and prevailing wage requirements to receive payment (Appendix E, Section V).
Adhere to non-discrimination and sexual harassment prevention requirements, including submitting an EEO Policy Statement (Form No. 4) and Statement on Sexual Harassment (Form No. 5).

Certify compliance with Iran Divestment Act, International Boycott Prohibition, MacBride Fair Employment Principles, prohibition on tropical hardwoods, and conflict-of-interest and political/religious activity restrictions (Appendix E, Sections Y–CC).

Submit a signed Certificate of Non-Collusion (Appendix E, Form No. 2), Lobbying Law Disclosure Statement (Form No. 3), EEO Policy Statement (Form No. 4), Statement on Sexual Harassment (Form No. 5), and RFP Acknowledgement and Certification (Form No. 6), all notarized where required.
Acknowledge all RFP addenda received or indicate that none were received using Appendix E, Form No. 1.
Comply with New York State Finance Law §§ 139-j and 139-k (Lobbying Law) regarding permissible contacts during the Restricted Period; all contacts must go through the designated NFWB contact.
Attend the mandatory pre-proposal information session at the Wastewater Treatment Plant on November 29, 2022 at noon.
Submit any written questions regarding the RFP to the authorized contact by November 30, 2022 at 3:00 p.m. via email with appropriate subject line.
Email the authorized NFWB contact (with copy as specified) to be placed on the distribution list for RFP updates and addenda.

Deliver one clearly marked original and six copies of the proposal package, plus one electronic copy on CD or USB, by the deadline to the address on the cover page, in a sealed outer envelope labeled with proposer name, address, RFP number, and title (Appendix E, Section J).
Ensure proposal is firm and irrevocable for 90 days from the submission deadline, unless amended by addendum (Appendix E, Section C).
Accept NFWB standard terms regarding proposal conditions, negotiation, exceptions handling, termination, governing law, and other general conditions (Appendix E, Sections B, E–H, F, GG–JJ).
Provide prompt responses to NFWB questions and participate in informal interviews or presentations if requested during evaluation.
Ensure no communication with NFWB personnel about the RFP occurs outside the designated contact during the Restricted Period, and certify Lobbying Law compliance on Form No. 3.

Relevant experience with similar SSES, I&I mitigation, and NYSDEC/EPG-funded projects; qualifications of firm, key staff, and subconsultants; ability to deliver all required tasks and comply with funding/contract terms.
Inclusion of all required sections, forms, utilization plans, schedules, budgets, and technical content; responsiveness to all RFP requirements and clarity of organization.
Reasonableness and competitiveness of total not-to-exceed fee for Phase 1 and option pricing for Phases 2 and 3, including contingency, relative to scope and value offered.

key_differentiators: Deep, demonstrated understanding of the LaSalle SSO context, NYSDEC expectations, R-value methodology, and how sewershed-focused SSES will drive measurable SSO reductions.
Proven track record delivering SSES, I&I mitigation, and SSO abatement projects in New York under Orders on Consent and EPG or similar funding, with successful NYSDEC approvals.

A clear, detailed technical approach that not only meets but enhances the minimum tasks (e.g., advanced data analytics, GIS integration, robust QA/QC, stakeholder communication plan) while minimizing disruption to residents.
Strong project management with a realistic, detailed schedule that aligns with NFWB’s constraints and enables construction in 2023–early 2024 and monitoring by June 2024.
Robust team qualifications, including NY-licensed PEs and specialists in flow monitoring, I&I analysis, and SCADA-informed operations, demonstrating capacity to manage multiple phases.
A compelling, well-structured proposal that is complete, easy to evaluate, and includes all required forms, utilization plans, and compliance documentation without deficiencies.
Competitive, transparent pricing with clear task/hour breakdowns and value-added efficiencies, including thoughtful treatment of the Task 6 contingency and option phases.
Strong MWBE and SDVOB participation plans that credibly meet or exceed the 30% MWBE and 6% SDVOB goals, supported by identified certified partners and clear roles.
Demonstrated ability to manage compliance, reporting, and coordination with NYSDEC, EFC, and NFWB, reducing administrative risk for the client.
